Replying to @philhawksworth 2021-11-09 19:26
@bouvyd @jlengstorf @jasonmcneill @cassidoo @codeFreedomRitr @kenny_io All front-ends are delivered by something, you’re right. But decoupling means that the front-end code can be crafted by front-end engineers without being hindered by what the back end can comfortably generate. APIs and other consumables are all lovely clean delineations.
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @bouvyd 2021-11-09 19:20
@bouvyd @jlengstorf @jasonmcneill @cassidoo @codeFreedomRitr @kenny_io We all have different experiences, speaking from mine, the first ~15 years of my career involved trying to execute front-end engineering when the front-end code was an output from the backend tech. This was one discipline radically compromising another. And the mainstream pattern
